Breadth-First.Explanation: Broad observation of park features and initial location hypotheses (Munich parks), divergent clue collection.
General clue gathering and image cropping idea without a firm hypothesis, still exploring broadly.
Lists multiple possible Munich sites (Reichenbachbrücke, Königsplatz) and rejects them, shallow comparisons.
Considers several named parks and even other countries (Berlin, Switzerland), broad hypothesis generation.
Explores building uses and multiple cities (Munich, Berlin, Amsterdam, Zurich) without narrowing to one location.
Returns to wide-ranging location ideas (Linz, Paris, Berlin) in search of a matching site.

Depth-First.Explanation: Focuses on specific hypothesis (Luitpoldpark near Bamberger Haus) and seeks concrete confirmation.
Verifies building details (netting, external staircases) against specific candidates (Bamberger Haus, school Turnhalle).
Systematically rules out other landmarks and confirms Luitpoldpark by matching key features.
Synthesizes converging clues (bollards, benches, table tennis, building renovation) to finalize the identification.

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Transition from broad exploration of many cities to focused verification of Luitpoldpark hypothesis.
After initial verification attempt, reopens to broader location possibilities (Linz, Paris, Berlin).
Shifts from broad city list back to detailed analysis of specific building candidates in Munich.
